# Readme



# install `kyoboLT` package


```r
devtools::install_github("lovetoken/kyoboLT")
```

# example

## `Xday_returns()` function


```r
index <- matrix(rnorm(60,1000, 8^2), 20, 3)
data <- xts(round(index, 1), as.Date(16001:16020)) # xts package for time series data
names(data) <- paste("Fund", 1:3, sep="_")
data
```

```
##            Fund_1 Fund_2 Fund_3
## 2013-10-23 1059.7 1034.3  912.7
## 2013-10-24 1026.2 1073.3 1072.2
## 2013-10-25 1079.7  880.0  950.4
## 2013-10-26  931.9  960.8 1009.5
## 2013-10-27  954.6 1066.8  993.2
## 2013-10-28 1014.3 1064.3 1090.5
## 2013-10-29 1037.4 1014.5  965.3
## 2013-10-30  939.3  937.3 1072.3
## 2013-10-31  973.0  949.1 1058.4
## 2013-11-01  959.7 1072.3  937.2
## 2013-11-02  942.6  912.0  953.3
## 2013-11-03  956.3 1044.0 1117.2
## 2013-11-04  926.8  992.5  891.4
## 2013-11-05  977.2 1145.1  864.7
## 2013-11-06 1123.8  972.5 1047.0
## 2013-11-07  876.8  985.9  999.6
## 2013-11-08  922.8  941.5 1075.7
## 2013-11-09  969.2  879.3  963.2
## 2013-11-10 1138.5  961.7 1016.4
## 2013-11-11 1015.1  881.6 1075.7
```

```r
Xday_returns(data, Xday=3) # basic 3 day returns
```

```
##                  Fund_1       Fund_2      Fund_3
## 2013-10-23           NA           NA          NA

## 2013-10-25           NA           NA          NA

```

```r
Xday_returns(data, Xday=3, log.returns = T) # calculation 3 day log returns
```


## `trim()` function


```r
trim("  Wow!  ", method="trailing")
```

```
## [1] "  Wow!"
```

```r
trim("  Wow!  ", method="leading")
```

```
## [1] "Wow!  "
```

```r
"  Wow!  " %>% trim %>% trim(method="leading")
```

```
## [1] "Wow!"
```
